body:
### Problem

Pressing the following keys does not show the expected results in neovim(extracted from https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/25068#issuecomment-1712547651):

```lua
local map = vim.api.nvim_set_keymap

map('n', '<s-c-f5>', [[<cmd>lua print('ctrl+shift+f5')<cr>]], {noremap = true})-- internally used
map('n', '<c-f5>', [[<cmd>lua print('ctrl+f5')<cr>]], {noremap = true})-- does work
map('n', '<s-f5>', [[<cmd>lua print('shift+f5')<cr>]], {noremap = true})-- does work
map('n', '<a-f5>', [[<cmd>lua print('alt+f5')<cr>]], {noremap = true})-- does work
```

`kitty +kitty show_key -m kitty` with aforementioned config shows:
```
shift+f5: CSI 15 ; 2 ~
ctrl+f5: CSI 15 ; 5 ~
shift+ctrl+f5: CSI 15 ; 6 ~
alt+f5: CSI 15 ; 3 ~
ctrl+shift+=: CSI 61 ; 6 u
``` 
Afaiu, Neovim is explicitly requesting this Kitty keyboard mode, so these should be the correct sequences.

Afaiu, this isn't restricted to Kitty keyboard protocol, because Kitty uses the legacy xterm/fixterms encoding for functional keys (source: https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/keyboard-protocol/#legacy-functional-keys and https://www.leonerd.org.uk/hacks/fixterms/). In both, it is described that the above quoted encodings are correct.

Please correct me, if anything I stated is wrong. cc @mitchellh, who investigated most of it after my first observations.

### Steps to reproduce

1. use kitty (at least that is the shell which should implement most of the kitty protocol)
2. `nvim -u min.lua`
3. press keys of keybindings to see, if the according strings are printed

### Expected behavior

Strings should be printed, as kitty sends the according escape codes.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-1055+gb7734c4ec

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no, 9.0

### Operating system/version

Linux pc 6.4.12-arch1-1

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.29.2

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

build from repo

comment_data.body: Does not reproduce with bare kitty. Does only reproduce within zellij.

title: certain modifier + function key keybinds do not work
